file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-20-04-05 - FUEL CONTROL PANEL - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FUEL CONTROL PANEL - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to do test of the fuel control panel. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FUEL CONTROL PANEL - OPERATIONAL ALL 28-20-04-700-801-A TEST EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-20-04 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-20-04-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FUEL CONTROL PANEL - OPERATIONAL TEST A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to do the operational test of the fuel control panel. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 AMM SDS 31-41-00/1 ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 - Cockpit D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. (1) Energize the aircraft with an external DC power supply ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, on the overhead panel, make sure that these circuit breakers are closed: (a) FUEL PUMP 1A, 1B, and 1C. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-20-04 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) FUEL PUMP 2A, 2B, and 2C. (c) CROSS FEED. (d) LIGHTS OVHD PANEL. (3) On the left DC distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1), make sure that these circuit breakers are closed: (a) FUEL PUMP 1A, 1C, and 2B. (4) On the right DC distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1), make sure that these circuit breakers are closed: (a) FUEL PUMP 1B, 2A, and 2C. CAUTION: DAMAGE TO THE FUEL PUMP WILL OCCUR IF IT OPERATES WITH NO FUEL (DRY OPERATION). THUS, MAKE SURE THAT THERE IS FUEL IN THE TANKS. (5) Make sure that the two wing fuel quantities are, at least, 100 Kg (220 lb). (6) Make sure that the switches on the fuel control panel are set as follows: Table 501 SWITCH SYSTEM POSITION XFEED OFF 1 1A PUMP SEL 2 2A 1 OFF PUMP PWR 2 OFF (7) On the MFD, select the FUEL system page (AMM SDS 31-41-00/1). J. Test Procedure (Figure 501) SUBTASK 020-002-A CAUTION: DAMAGE TO THE FUEL PUMP WILL OCCUR IF IT OPERATES WITH NO FUEL (DRY OPERATION). THUS, MAKE SURE THAT THERE IS FUEL IN THE TANKS. (1) Do an operational test of the PUMP SEL and PUMP PWR switches of tank 1 as follows: (a) Set the PUMP PWR switch of TANK 1 to ON position. Result: 1 On the MFD fuel page, the "A" indication for the tank 1 pump comes into view. (b) Set the PUMP SEL switch to the 1B position. Result: 1 On the MFD fuel page, the "B" indication for the tank 1 pump comes into view. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-20-04 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (c) Set the PUMP SEL switch to the 1C position. Result: 1 On the MFD fuel page, the "C" indication for the tank 1 pump comes into view. (d) Set the PUMP PWR switch of TANK 1 to OFF position. Result: 1 On the MFD fuel page, the "OFF" indication for the tank 1 pump comes into view. (e) Set the PUMP SEL switch to the 1A position. (2) Do an operational test of the PUMP SEL and PUMP PWR switches of tank 2 as follows: (a) Set the PUMP PWR switch of TANK 2 to the ON position. Result: 1 On the MFD fuel page, the "A" indication for the tank 2 pump comes into view. (b) Set the PUMP SEL switch to the 2B position. Result: 1 On the MFD display, the "B" indication for the tank 2 pump comes into view. (c) Set the PUMP SEL switch to the 2C position. Result: 1 On the MFD display, the "C" indication for the tank 2 pump comes into view. (d) Set the PUMP PWR switch of TANK 2 to the OFF position. Result: 1 On the MFD display, the "OFF" indication for the tank 2 pump comes into view. (e) Set the PUMP SEL switch to the 2A position. (3) Do an operational test of the XFEED switch as follows: (a) Set the XFEED switch to the LOW 1 position. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the FUEL XFEED OPEN advisory message comes into view. (b) Set the XFEED switch to the LOW 2 position. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the FUEL XFEED OPEN advisory message comes into view. (c) Set the XFEED switch to the OFF position. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the FUEL XFEED OPEN advisory message goes out of view. (4) Test the lighting of the fuel control panel as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-20-04 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) On the lighting control panel, on the overhead panel, turn the OVHD PNL LT knob from OFF to the BRT position. Result: 1 On the fuel control panel, the legends come on. (b) On the lighting control panel, on the overhead panel, turn the OVHD PNL LT knob from BRT to the OFF position. Result: 1 On the fuel control panel, the legends go off. K. Follow on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 28-20-04 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
